Here is a basic ontology dedicated to the concept of 'President':1. **Entity:** President.     - Attributes: Name, Birth date, Birthplace, Term in Office, Political Party Affiliation.2. **Sub-Entities**:     - U.S President.        - Special Attributes: State Represented, Vice President, Presidential Number.    - Company President.        - Special Attributes: Company Name, Industry, Years of Service.    - University President.        - Special Attributes: University Name, Academic Background.3. **Relations:**    - Serves As.    - Preceded By.    - Succeeded By.4. **Actions:**   - Elected.   - Serve.   - Retire.5. **Types of Presidential Elections:**   - General Election.   - Midterm Election.   - Recalled Election.6. **Roles:**   - Upholds Constitution (specific to U.S Presidents).   - Represents party.   - Chief executive (in both political and business contexts, responsibilities might vary).   - Diplomatic role.7. **Related Entities:**   - Vice President.   - First Lady/First Man/First Partner.   - Cabinet.   - Citizens/Shareholders/Students (depending on type of presidency).   - Opponent(s) in Elections.8. **Policies/Legislation/Vision:**   - Foreign Policy.   - Economic Policy.   - Educational Policy.   - Company Policies/Business Strategy/University Strategic Plan.This ontology helps structure the concept of "president" across multiple domains — politics, business, and academia, primarily, with related elements to better understand the role and its constituents.
